3.5. Due Date for Payment. Your Royalty payments and Advertising Contributions are due by the first (1st) day after the end of each
Period (or the next business day if the first day is a Sunday or federal holiday) (as of the Agreement Date, the due date is Monday of each week).
You must pay all other amounts due to us as specified in this Agreement or, if no time is specified, such amounts are due upon receipt of an invoice
from us.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5. Due Date for Payment. Your Royalty payments and Advertising Contributions are due by the tenth (10th) day after the end of each
Period (or the next business day if the tenth day is a Sunday or federal holiday) (as of the Agreement Date, the due date is Wednesday of the following week).
You must pay all other amounts due to us as specified in this Agreement within 30 days of receipt of an invoice from us.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct contradiction regarding the payment deadlines for royalty fees, advertising contributions, and other specified amounts. Previously, royalty and advertising were due the 1st day after each period, while other amounts were due upon invoice receipt. Now, royalty and advertising are due the 10th day, and other amounts are due within 30 days, causing uncertainty about enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
4.3 Location Development and Preparation. You must construct, furnish, and open the Franchised Business as required by this
Agreement and must open the Franchised Business not later than six (6) months after securing the necessary authorization and approval for
permits and/or certificates. Time is of the essence.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.3 Location Development and Preparation. You must construct, furnish, and open the Franchised Business as required by this
Agreement; however, the opening date can be extended indefinitely upon written approval from the Franchisor. Time is not of the essence.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that while the franchisee must construct, furnish, and open the business, the deadline can be extended indefinitely, negating the importance of the original six-month timeframe. This introduces uncertainty in enforcement, as the 'time is of the essence' clause is removed, conflicting with other sections that rely on a fixed deadline.

perturbation.original_text:
15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default. You will be in default under this Agreement if you fail,
refuse, or neglect to pay when due (including if we are not able to collect payments by electronic fund transfer pursuant to Section 3.6 [Method of
Payment] due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason resulting in the nonpayment) any monies
owing to us, our affiliates, or any lender that has provided financing to you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or to your landlord
and/or any supplier of goods or services to your Franchised Business. You will have ten (10) days after written notice of such default from us
within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 10-day period (or such longer
period as applicable law may require). If you do not cure the default within such 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may
require), this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time
period.
perturbation.changed_text:
15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default. You will be in default under this Agreement if you fail,
refuse, or neglect to pay when due (including if we are not able to collect payments by electronic fund transfer pursuant to Section 3.6 [Method of
Payment] due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason resulting in the nonpayment) any monies
owing to us, our affiliates, or any lender that has provided financing to you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or to your landlord
and/or any supplier of goods or services to your Franchised Business. You will have one (1) days after written notice of such default from us
within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 30-day period (or such longer
period as applicable law may require). If you do not cure the default within such 30-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may
require), this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time
period.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by stating that the franchisee will have both one day and thirty days to remedy the default. This directly conflicts with the ten-day cure period previously stated and causes confusion on enforcement of the contract.
